title: U.S. shares lower at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.59%
text:
© Reuters. U.S. shares lower at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.59%

Investing.com – U.S. equities were lower at the close on Friday, as losses in the , and sectors propelled shares lower.

At the close in NYSE, the declined 0.59%, while the index declined 0.49%, and the index declined 0.80%.

The biggest gainers of the session on the were Merck & Company Inc (NYSE: ), which rose 1.42% or 1.19 points to trade at 85.16 at the close. Dow Inc (NYSE: ) added 1.20% or 0.57 points to end at 48.21 and Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: ) was up 1.18% or 1.54 points to 131.65 in late trade.

Biggest losers included Intel Corporation (NASDAQ: ), which lost 1.65% or 0.85 points to trade at 50.72 in late trade. Home Depot Inc (NYSE: ) declined 1.51% or 3.45 points to end at 224.67 and Caterpillar Inc (NYSE: ) shed 1.51% or 1.96 points to 128.16.

The top performers on the S&P 500 were Incyte Corporation (NASDAQ: ) which rose 3.96% to 81.21, Align Technology Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was up 3.43% to settle at 186.54 and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc (NASDAQ: ) which gained 3.40% to close at 295.87.

The worst performers were Xilinx Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was down 6.82% to 96.55 in late trade, Netflix Inc (NASDAQ: ) which lost 5.53% to settle at 270.75 and MSCI Inc (NYSE: ) which was down 4.10% to 225.73 at the close.

The top performers on the NASDAQ Composite were Reebonz Holding Ltd (NASDAQ: ) which rose 32.99% to 2.58, Benitec Biopharma Ltd ADR (NASDAQ: ) which was up 18.86% to settle at 0.8201 and Replimune Group Inc (NASDAQ: ) which gained 16.75% to close at 16.87.

The worst performers were USA Technologies Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was down 34.77% to 4.990 in late trade, Francescas Holdings (NASDAQ: ) which lost 24.80% to settle at 11.16 and AEterna Zentaris Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was down 22.42% to 1.280 at the close.

Advancing stocks outnumbered falling ones by 1454 to 1401 and 101 ended unchanged; on the Nasdaq Stock Exchange, 1346 rose and 1328 declined, while 70 ended unchanged on the New York Stock Exchange.

The , which measures the implied volatility of S&P 500 options, was up 9.04% to 15.32.

In commodities trading, Gold Futures for December delivery was up 1.19% or 17.85 to $1524.05 a troy ounce. Meanwhile, Crude oil for delivery in November rose 0.38% or 0.22 to hit $58.41 a barrel, while the November Brent oil contract rose 0.36% or 0.23 to trade at $64.63 a barrel.

EUR/USD was down 0.21% to 1.1017, while USD/JPY fell 0.40% to 107.56.

The US Dollar Index Futures was up 0.24% at 98.085.
description: U.S. shares lower at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.59%
